title: Georgian Era Words
description: Explore the language of 18th-century Britain during the Georgian period (1714-1830)

questions.question: In Georgian England, what was a 'sedan chair'?
options: An enclosed chair carried on poles by two bearers

questions.question: What did 'dissipation' typically mean in Georgian social life?
options: Excessive indulgence in pleasures and amusements

questions.question: In Georgian vocabulary, what was a 'highwayman'?
options: A robber who held up travelers on public roads

questions.question: What was a 'rout' in Georgian high society?
options: A large fashionable evening party or reception

questions.question: In Georgian England, what were 'pleasure gardens'?
options: Public parks with entertainment, music, and refreshments

questions.question: What was a 'periwig' (or 'peruke') in Georgian fashion?
options: An elaborate wig worn by men and women

questions.question: In Georgian slang, what did 'foxed' mean?
What was a 'snuffbox' in Georgian society?
options: A small decorative container for powdered tobacco

questions.question: In Georgian England, what was 'laudanum'?
options: An opium-based tincture commonly used as medicine

questions.question: What was a 'fop' in Georgian vocabulary?
options: A man excessively concerned with his appearance and clothes

questions.question: In Georgian times, what was a 'coffeehouse'?
options: A house made of coffee beans
A public establishment where men gathered to drink coffee and discuss business and politics

questions.question: What did 'sensible' primarily mean in Georgian English?
options: Aware of or able to feel or perceive

questions.question: In Georgian England, what was a 'gibbet'?
options: A structure for publicly displaying the bodies of executed criminals

questions.question: What was a 'turnpike' in the Georgian era?
options: A toll road maintained by a trust

questions.question: In Georgian vocabulary, what was a 'masquerade'?
options: A ball or party where guests wore masks and costumes
